<@U3B2F5VC0|rkr> has joined the channel

Hi everyone. I see a story for updating the Vagrant development environment <https://jira.hyperledger.org/projects/STL/issues/STL-4?filter=allopenissues>. I am trying to follow the instructions for building the necessary sawtooth lake related packages in Ubuntu. Will there be updates to those as well as part of this FAB?
My intent is to run a Sawtooth lake validator outside of Vagrant...

I tried to create the necessary Ubuntu packages by the following the instructions in  <http://intelledger.github.io/sysadmin_guide/packaging_ubuntu.html> and also trying to follow the installation instructions in Ubuntu <http://intelledger.github.io/sysadmin_guide/installation_ubuntu.html#prerequisites>. I am not able to start or stop the validator using the upstart.
<@U24M29R4G|nikileshsa> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/nikileshsa/F3CHFBQEA/-.dockerfile|Untitled>

n:~/projects$ start sawtooth-validator
start: Unknown job: sawtooth-validator
n:~/projects$

start: Unknown job: sawtooth-validator
n:~/projects$

with sudo its still the same.. ```sudo start sawtooth-validator

oops!
we have a script to package validator, I forgot about that.
if you run bin/package_validator, it’ll create a deb with a postinst script that creates that user.
oh ok. got it! I manually created the user to resolve this issue.. I will check that script to see if I missed anything..
<@U0Z5FGD0V> thanks again!
Sorry about the trouble!
no worries. thanks for the quick help!

I am trying to run the validator in a desktop running  Ubuntu 14.04  and the CPU has SGX enabled and the necessary SGX drivers and SGX SDK/PSW  installed. I am trying to make use of SGX enabled CPU to experiment with Sawtooth lake. Is there a way to configure the PoET to run against the native SGX enabled CPU instead of the current simulated version? I guess I asked this question a couple of days back <@U0VKPD6A2> replied saying there should be no integration issues.. Is there some configuration I need to be aware to run the validator against the SGX enabled CPU? Once enabled, How would I test if the validator is using the SGX?
Oh, sorry if that was not clear. I meant if an SGX module was written. Right now the code only has the simulated enclave.
